abstracts.cdata!:
The Rehabilitation and Completion of
            Irrigation and Drainage Infrastructure Project aims to
            prevent the decline in supplying water to Baku City,
            eliminate further deterioration of the supply of irrigation
            water to approximately 86,000 hectares (ha) along the
            Sumur-Apsheron Canal; and improve drainage and reduce water
            logging and salinity on approximately 36,500 ha along
            Main-Mugan Collector. The project constitutes three
            components: 1) Rehabilitation and completion of irrigation
            and drainage infrastructure will support rehabilitation of
            critical main infrastructure of the Samur-Apsheron Canal
            (SAC) System, which comprises a headworks across the Samur
            river, a main supply canal, a reservoir near Baku City,
            pumping stations, three sediment basins, and a number of
            secondary canals that supply water to the irrigation areas.
            2) Institutional strengthening will support institutional
            development to make a start with the improvement of the
            quality and sustainability of irrigation management by
            supporting technical assistance to review the work practice
            of SAC and training. 3) Project implementation support will
            cover part of the incremental staff salaries and operational
            expenses of the Project Implementation Unit, and the annual
            monitoring and evaluation.
